item.title: lsr: ls but with io_uring
item.description: As an excercise in syscall golf, I wrote an implementation of ls(1) which uses my IO library, ourio to perform as much of the IO as possible. What I ended up with is something that is faster than any version or alternative to ls I tested, and also performs an order of magnitude fewer syscalls. I’m calling it lsr. Let’s start with the benchmarks, then we’ll see how we got there.

item.title: NIH Is Far Cheaper Than The Wrong Dependency
item.description: Frivilous dependencies are the enemy of maintainability.

item.title: Anthropic tightens usage limits for Claude Code – without telling users | TechCrunch
item.description: Claude Code users have been hit with unexpectedly restrictive usage limits. The problems, many of which have been aired on Claude Code’s GitHub page, seem to be concentrated among heavy users of the service, many of whom are on the $200-a-month Max plan.
